creator: odin666666@hotmail.com
text:
In the official ANT's documentation in the javac target page is written : 
"If the environment variable JIKES_HOME is set to the location of the jikes
compiler, then the standard Ant invocation scripts automatically
set build.compiler to "jikes". "

however, it doesn't work on my box. I've read the bin/ant script and didn't
notice anything about JIKES_HOME var.

best regards

you are correct. The documentation isn't. The env variable in question is 
JIKESPATH and it should contain the path to where jikes is installed. The 
documentation needs fixing.
creator: steve_l@iseran.com

text:
I'm really confused about this, and rummaging through the source has only got 
me more confused. 

1. I always thought that setting the JIKESPATH env variable would force the 
javac task to hand off to jikes, thus letting you control which compiler you 
used on a per-user basis, rather than hard code it into a build file.

2. but it doesn't, does it? All it does it set the java property 
jikes.class.path which is then appended to the classpath passed in to jikes as 
a parameter. 

3. So the only way to set the compiler for a user across all projects seems to 
be to set ANT_OPTS=-Dbuild.compiler=jikes 

Am I correct in this statement? If so I will fix up the javac.html file to 
mention this fact. Or maybe pull out all mention of the concept from the javac 
html file and instead cover this trick in the 'using ant in production' doco, 
where the same misassumption has been replicated.
creator: steve_l@iseran.com

text:
Fixed in the documentation of Ant1.4.1 -no mention at all of setting compiler 
options outside ant in the javac task, a full paragraph of using ANT_OPTS in 
the 'using ant in production' doco.
